My notes about how to Linux Form Scratch (10.0 Stable)
for full doc:
http://www.linuxfromscratch.org/lfs/read.html
1. download virtualbox and install it: https://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/Downloads
2. create host(arch) vm  because gentoo livecd currently not available and i don’t wanna use ubuntu as host
 i use :
10G .vdi image
UEFI: ON
first booting: 1 type:
$# timedatectl set-ntp true	#NTP on $# cfdisk	#tui partiton select gpt
my setup:
/dev/sda1 512M for boot
/dev/sda2 4G for host (will remove the host later)
free: 5.5G
$# lsblk	#for disk check $# mkfs.fat -F 32 /dev/sda1	#make sda1 as FAT32 $# mkfs.ext4 /dev/sda2	#make sda2 as ext4 $# mount /dev/sda2 /mnt	#mount it as root $# mkdir -p /mnt/boot/efi	#create efi boot folder $# mount /dev/sda1 /mnt/boot/efi	#mount it as efi boot $# pacstrap /mnt base linux linux-firmware sudo grub efibootmgr networkmanager intel-ucode vim $# genfstab -U /mnt >> /mnt/etc/fstab $# arch-chroot /mnt in chroot:
$# ln -sf /usr/share/zoneinfo/America/New_York /etc/localtime $# hwclock --systohc $# vim /etc/locale.gen uncomment #en_US.UTF-8 UTF-8 by remove #
then :wq
$# locale-gen $# echo "LANG=en_US.UTF-8" >> /etc/locale.conf $# systemctl enable NetworkManager $# useradd -m -G wheel -s /bin/bash host $# visudo uncomment # %wheel ALL=(ALL) ALL by remove #
then :wq
$# passwd host	#Set New Password $# grub-install /dev/sda $# grub-mkconfig -o /boot/grub/grub.cfg $# exit $# reboot second booting: select Arch Linux
then login host
and enter the password
$ sudo pacman -Sy	#to update packages $ sudo pacman -Syu	#to upgrade packages to lastest ssh to virtualbox: $ sudo pacman -S openssh $ systemctl start sshd	#start server $ systemctl enable sshd	#to start it when boot then refer:
https://dev.to/yassineselllami/how-to-ssh-into-ubuntu-vm-virtualbox-from-host-machine-1kii
3. configure host to check the requires:
$ curl -sL https://github.com/viktomas/linux-from-scratch/raw/master/version-check.sh | bash For LFS 10.0 install require packages:
$ sudo pacman -S bash binutils bison bzip2 coreutils diffutils findutils gawk gcc glibc grep gzip linux to reboot and apply latest kernel:
$ sudo grub-mkconfig -o /boot/grub/grub.cfg $ sudo reboot after reboot change to root:
$ sudo su type:
$# cfdisk	#tui partiton use left space (5.5G)
to set new partition as /dev/sda3 (LFS root)
then format as ext4:
$# mkfs -v -t ext4 /dev/sda3	#make sda3 as ext4 Set $LFS:
$# export LFS=/mnt/lfs  $# echo $LFS	#to check export  $# mkdir -pv $LFS	#make $LFS folder $# mount -v -t ext4 /dev/sda3 $LFS	#mount sda3 to $LFS  to prevent unmount when reboot, halt; add your LFS partition to /etc/fstab, for example:
add
/dev/<xxx>	/mnt/lfs ext4	defaults	1	1  $# mkdir -v $LFS/sources	#make folder for sources $# chmod -v a+wt $LFS/sources	#to add write permission and sticky mark Download require source packages: 2 First install wget:
$# pacman -S wget	#in root # or $ sudo pacman -S wget	#for sudo user There are several ways to optain all the necessary packages and patches to build LFS:
  The files can be downloaded individually as described in the next two sections.
  For stable versions of the book, a tarball of all the needed files can be downloaded from one of the LFS files mirrors listed at http://www.linuxfromscratch.org/mirrors.html#files.
  The files can be downloaded using wget and a wget-list as described below.
To download all of the packages and patches by using wget-list as an input to the wget command, use:
  $# wget http://www.linuxfromscratch.org/lfs/view/stable/wget-list	#download stable wget-list $# wget --input-file=wget-list --continue --directory-prefix=$LFS/sources	#download packages using wget-list  To check packages or download manually:
http://www.linuxfromscratch.org/lfs/view/stable/chapter03/packages.html
   refer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ctp-5MRgxGA ↩︎
 refer: http://www.linuxfromscratch.org/lfs/view/stable/chapter03/introduction.html (LFS 10.0 Stable) ↩︎
summary: My notes about how to Linux Form Scratch (10.0 Stable)
title: Linux Form Scratch 10.0 Notes [WIP]

Record the experience and experience of going to the 2021 Taipei International Animation Festival
 Translated by Google, original post here: Original  1 In the morning, my friend and I met at a breakfast shop. After having breakfast, we went out through the MRT gate and saw a crowd of people surrounding the entire venue. . We walked by the man-made wall and asked a person who was standing in line about the direction of the line. At this moment, it was almost ten o’clock in the morning, and we were guided to wait in line outside the main entrance (area 13-D). On the stalled team, friends sat down together, one of them was chasing “Goblin Slayer”, the others were playing games. During this period, I saw students ordering Foodpanda, workers eating lunch on another shelter, and some cos “Re: Life in a Different World from Zero” Rem and “Wolf Game” Iida Rentaro. It took about half an hour before someone gradually moved, and my friends began to prepare to order McDonald’s. This is the scene at the time:
 Are there too many people! ! !
  2 (About an hour later)
At that time, I thought that the entrance was the venue, and when I entered:
 You have to row inside! ! !
 Not only that, but the number of people on the second floor gradually increased.
 (There are too many kapok rows, right)
  3 (After queuing for nearly four hours)
Finally arrived at the venue. The first thing we entered was not to grab the lucky bag immediately, but to walk around the whole venue first. These were taken while shopping:
 One Piece
  Compared with Good Smile!
  Lots of people
  Hanako-kun! ! ! Hui Ye! ! !
  I also saw a big drawing board, but unfortunately I didn‚Äôt get it
Of course there must be ghosts, hatsune, JOJO, guinea pigs
Children only watch the Blade of Ghost Slayer, adults watch Guinea Pigs
  4 I walked the whole venue and sat by the wall with my friends. I looked at them for a while and wanted to say why I went to Kapok to buy a slime bag before I started buying a lucky bag. When I came back and waited until my friend started to act, a friend who wanted to buy Pikachu went to the Mandy store first, and then went to the gashapon store, who had better luck. Then we worked in groups, one group went to Kapok, another group went to Good Smile, and I went to Lingbang. When I arrived outside the Lingbang store, I found that the queue was full…
 My spell is back to the flash drive
 I sat with two friends outside the second gate, waiting for everyone to arrive. In about a few minutes, let them tell us to eat first and go to a restaurant that two people think is not bad:
 This is the invoice and easy tap
  Miso Ramen
  Also Miso Ramen
 When they returned to the second door, they had already bought McDonald’s and animation merchandise. So after eating McDonald’s there, I went to Taipei Station to order a drink, and then walked away.
 End This is the above notes and experience!
summary: Record the experience and experience of going to the 2021 Taipei International Animation Festival
title: 2021 Taipei International Animation Festival-Notes

A tutorial about how to install and deploy your Hugo site on Github Pages
Install Hugo ‘1’  Homebrew and MacPorts, package managers for macOS, can be installed from brew.sh or macports.org respectively. See install if you are running Windows etc.
 brew install hugo # or port install hugo To verify your new install:
hugo version Git  (Recommend for Hugo)
 Install Git Check the git if installed:
git --version If you‚Äôve installed it, it shows your version of git, if not, it will prompt you to install it automatically.
Set Git Repo There’s two ways to set:
Init Git Repo cd `Site_Location` git init Site_Location is the location you want to place the site folder at
Clone Existing Repo cd `Site_Location` git clone `Git_Repo` Site_Location is the location you want to place the site folder at
Optional: Push to Github Build Site Create Run the command in terminal:
cd `Site_Location` hugo new site `Site_Name` Site_Location is the location you want to place the site folder at
Site_Name is a site name for example
Aften then, change to the site directory:
cd `Site_Name` Install Theme In your site directory, run the command in terminal:
cd themes git clone `Theme_Git_URL` change the Theme_Git_URL to the URL of the theme you want to install
After that, go back to site’s root directory by  cd ../
and add the theme to the site configuration:
 Choose either one
If you don’t know, just output to the toml format unless you or the theme needs to use yml/yaml
 echo 'theme = "`Theme_Name`"' >> config.toml # to config.toml echo 'theme = "`Theme_Name`"' >> config.yml # to config.yml Alternative In your site directory, Download the Theme_Name theme using git submodule:
git submodule add `Theme_Git_URL` themes/`Theme_Name`  Note for non-git users: ‘1’
 If you do not have git installed, you can download the archive of the latest version of this theme from: https://github.com/budparr/gohugo-theme-ananke/archive/master.zip Extract that .zip file to get a ‚Äúgohugo-theme-ananke-master‚Äù directory. Rename that directory to ‚Äúananke‚Äù, and move it into the ‚Äúthemes/‚Äù directory.   Config Compile To compile the site:
hugo Yeah, that’s it.
 But if you have a theme, just add -t Theme_Name option
hugo -t `Theme_Name`  Run as Server ‘1’ Start the Hugo server:
hugo serverStart the Hugo server with drafts enabled:
hugo server -DIt will show the output:
 | EN+------------------+----+Pages | 10Paginator pages | 0Non-page files | 0Static files | 3Processed images | 0Aliases | 1Sitemaps | 1Cleaned | 0Total in 11 msWatching for changes in /Users/bep/quickstart/{content,data,layouts,static,themes}Watching for config changes in /Users/bep/quickstart/config.tomlEnvironment: "development"Serving pages from memoryRunning in Fast Render Mode. For full rebuilds on change: hugo server --disableFastRenderWeb Server is available at http://localhost:1313/ (bind address 127.0.0.1)Press Ctrl+C to stopNavigate to your new site at http://localhost:1313/.
Feel free to edit or add new content and simply refresh in browser to see changes quickly (You might need to force refresh in webbrowser, something like Ctrl-R usually works).
Finish And now you have finished to build your site. üòª
Add Post ‘1’ You can manually create content files (for example as content/<CATEGORY>/<FILE>.<FORMAT>) and provide metadata in them, however you can use the new command to do a few things for you (like add title and date):
hugo new posts/my-first-post.mdEdit the newly created content file if you want, it will start with something like this:
--- title: "My First Post" date: 2019-03-26T08:47:11+01:00 draft: true ---  Drafts do not get deployed; once you finish a post, update the header of the post to say draft: false. More info here.
 Deploy another Git Repo for Public (github.io) New Git Repo Clone github.io Repo Compile Push to github.io Repo PS: Automatic Update Script End That’s all for the tutorial, happy blogging~~~
For more information about Hugo or Github Pages, you can go to these both official sites:
https://gohugo.io/
https://pages.github.com/
  from: https://gohugo.io/getting-started/quick-start/ ↩︎
summary: A tutorial about how to install and deploy your Hugo site on Github Pages
title: Build Website on Github by Hugo (WIP)

Blockquotes The blockquote element represents content that is quoted from another source, optionally with a citation which must be within a footer or cite element, and optionally with in-line changes such as annotations and abbreviations.
Blockquote without attribution  Tiam, ad mint andaepu dandae nostion secatur sequo quae. Note that you can use Markdown syntax within a blockquote.
